subject: Business
title: The Wealth Gap: Understanding Inequality
description: A quick win: understand The Wealth Gap: Understanding Inequality.

hook.text: The richest 1% own more wealth than the bottom 90% combined. That gap has doubled in 40 years.

buildup.text: The wealth gap measures the difference in net worth between the richest and poorest segments of a population.

discovery.text: Capital (investments) grows faster than wages. Those who own assets get richer; those who only earn wages fall behind.

twist.text: Thomas Piketty showed that when return on capital exceeds economic growth (r > g), inequality naturally increases.

climax.text: During COVID, billionaire wealth grew $3.9 trillion while 100 million fell into poverty. The gap accelerated.

punchline.text: Understanding the system is the first step to navigating it.

quiz.question: What did Piketty show about inequality?
options: When return on capital exceeds economic growth, inequality naturally increases
All countries have equal wealth distribution
